basic.description: This course examines dispute resolution in international commerce, focusing on questions of institutional design, domestic and international law, and the political economy of global business. In preparation for discussing the specifics of dispute resolution under NAFTA and the WTO, the course begins with various theories of negotiation, from game theory to social psychology.
basic.subject: COMM
basic.title: Conciliation & Dispute Resolut

extra.enrollment_requirement: (Prerequisite of COMM180 and registered in a BCOM Academic Program and have a level > than or equal to 3) or registered in a COMM-X Academic Plan.
